meanings.definition: Resembling a farce, absurd or ridiculous in nature.
meanings.sent1: The play was farcical, filled with silly jokes and exaggerated characters.
meanings.sent2: The movie's farcical scenes had everyone in the theater laughing.
meanings.sent3: The farcical situation of a penguin trying to fly made the children giggle.
meanings.sent4: Her attempt to cook dinner without any ingredients was a farcical disaster.
meanings.sent5: The clown's farcical antics entertained the audience for hours.

meanings.sent1: His farcical behavior at the party embarrassed his friends.
meanings.sent2: The comedian's farcical performance had the audience roaring with laughter.
meanings.sent3: The farcical imitation of the teacher made the students burst into giggles.
meanings.sent4: The politician's promises were so farcical that nobody took him seriously.
meanings.sent5: The farcical gestures of the mime entertained the crowd in the park.

meanings.sent1: The cat's farcical attempts to catch its tail amused the children.
meanings.sent2: The situation was so farcical that even the grumpiest person couldn't help but smile.
meanings.sent3: His farcical dance moves at the party made everyone burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: The farcical excuses he made for being late were beyond belief.
meanings.sent5: The farcical comedy show had the audience in stitches from start to finish.
